ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:0.5_0: The second training rule on disposing of feces
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:1.2_0: At that time a brahmin had a barley field next to the nuns’ dwelling place.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:1.3_0: The nuns dispose of feces, urine, trash, and food scraps on cultivated plants.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:1.4_0: The brahmin then complained and criticized him,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:1.5_0: “How can the nuns spoil my barley field?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:1.6_0: The nuns heard the complaints of that brahmin,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:1.7_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:1.8_0: “How can nuns dispose of feces, urine, trash, and food scraps on cultivated plants?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:1.9_0: “Is it true, monks, that nuns did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:1.12_0: “How can nuns dispose of feces, urine, trash, and food scraps on cultivated plants?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:1.13_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:1.14_0: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:1.15.1_0: ‘If a nun disposes of feces or urine or trash or food scraps on cultivated plants, or she has it disposed of in this way, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.1.4_0: ...The nun who has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.1.12_0: food remnants or bones or used water.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.1.14_0: grain, vegetables, whatever cultivated plants people consider valuable or useful.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.1.15_0: if she disposes of it at the right time;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.1.16_0: if she disposes of it herself, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.1.18_0: if he asks another, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.1.19_0: If he only asks once, then even if the other disposes of it, he commits one offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.2.1_0: If they are cultivated plants, and she perceives them as such, and she disposes of it or has it disposed of, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.2.2_0: If they are cultivated plants, but she is unsure of it, and she disposes of it or has it disposed of, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.2.3_0: If they are cultivated plants, but she perceives them as such, and she disposes of it or has it disposed of, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.2.4_0: If they are uncultivated plants, but she perceives them as cultivated, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.2.5_0: If they are uncultivated plants, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.2.6_0: If they are uncultivated plants, and she perceives them as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.3.2_0: if she disposes of it after having looked;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.3.3_0: if she disposes of it at the edge of the field;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.3.4_0: if she disposes of it after asking and getting permission from the owners;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.3.6_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.3.7_0: The ninth training rule is finished.
